availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Calvin Robb (Franklin County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier (C.S.A.))

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Jessamine County, Kentucky, native. Son of Frederick Robb and Mary "Polly" Neet Robb. Farmer in Franklin County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned three enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1850. Farmer in Franklin County in 1860. Served in the 9th Kentucky Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as second lieutenant from October 12, 1862, to August 21, 1863. Served in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as second lieutenant from August 22, 1863, to October 1864.
